conclusion: Liquid flows out from points A, B, and C at the top.
There are several colored baffles angled to redirect the flow of liquid.
There are two containers at the bottom: D (left) and E (right).
Goal is to determine which container the liquid will end up in after interacting with the baffles.
Orange baffle below A slants downward to the left.
Cyan baffle below B and C slants downward to the left.
White baffle in the middle left slants downward to the right.
Purple baffle below white baffle slants downward to the right.
Yellow baffle in the middle right slants downward to the left.
Liquid from A falls onto the orange baffle and slides to the left end.
Liquid from A falls from the left end of the orange baffle onto the white baffle.
Liquid from A slides to the right end of the white baffle and falls onto the purple baffle.
Liquid from A slides to the right end of the purple baffle and falls into container E.
Liquid from B falls onto the cyan baffle and slides to the left end.
Liquid from B falls from the left end of the cyan baffle onto the white baffle.
Liquid from B slides to the right end of the white baffle and falls onto the purple baffle.
Liquid from B slides to the right end of the purple baffle and falls into container E.
Liquid from C falls onto the cyan baffle and slides to the left end.
Liquid from C falls from the left end of the cyan baffle onto the white baffle.
Liquid from C slides to the right end of the white baffle and falls onto the purple baffle.
Liquid from C slides to the right end of the purple baffle and falls into container E.
Yellow baffle is positioned to the right side of the setup.
